SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
AssetSetter
The AssetSetter class is responsible for placing game objects such as keys, door, chest, blue heart in the game world.
Client
The Client class represents the entry point for the 2D game.
CollisionChecker
This class is responsible for checking collisions between entities and tiles or objects in the game.
Entity
Represents an entity in the game, such as a player or an object.
GameClient
The GameClient class represents a client that communicates with a server using the UDP protocol.
GamePanel
The GamePanel class is responsible for rendering and managing the game state.
GameServer
The GameServer class represents a simple UDP server that listens for messages from clients and sends responses back to the clients.
GameWindow
The GameWindow class is responsible for creating the main window of the game.
KeyHandler
KeyHandler class handles keyboard input for the game.
NetworkManager
This class manages network communication between the client and server, as well as tracking the player's time in the game.
OBJ_Blueheart
Represents the Blueheart object in the game
OBJ_Chest
Represents the Chest object in the game
OBJ_Door
Represents the Door object in the game
OBJ_Key
Represents the Key object in the game
Player
Represents the player in the game.
PlayerTimeManager
This class manages the player's playtime in the game.
Sound
This class manages sound effects and background music for the game.
SuperObject
Represents an object in the game.
Tile
This class represents tile in the game world.
TileManager
This class manages the tiles in the game world It loads tile images, handles the map, and renders tiles on the screen.
UI
The UI class handles the user interface rendering for the game, including the title screen, messages, game-over screen, and in-game UI elements like the player's playtime and keys.
UtilityTool
Utility class that provides methods for common image-related operations, such as scaling images.
